website_summaries.verdict: The best budget option for a simple, easy-to-use folding shovel and entrenching tool.
pros: Shovel folds down in a tri-fold design, preserving more space inside common bags and packs
Looped handle is large and comfortable to hold for long periods of time
cons: The shovel is on the smaller side and is difficult to use for larger digging projects

customer_reviews.title: Gave it to my grandkids camping broke it digging in ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my grandkids camping broke it digging in sand. I guess a four year old is tougher then the shovel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The metal that makes up the shovel is pretty poor. I've had to rebend/shape the shovel and ...
customer_reviews.text: The metal that makes up the shovel is pretty poor. I've had to rebend/shape the shovel and the base of the shovel that connects to the rest of the product. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: The Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Fits in the palm of your hand!
customer_reviews.text: Like a newborn hamster in size. just sits there all cute and cuddly. THEN you unfold it, and its like a NFL linebacker's forearm holding an apple mixed with the greatest zombie head smashing instrument of all time. I would buy five or ten and hide them in all the places you frequent. that way if zombies DO try to finger scoop your brains out like warm pudding. you'll be ready to temple stick'em with the pointy end. and if the zombie was a loved one the shovel end works beautifully for diggin' a dirt nappin' spot. p.s. I apologize if any snowflakes were harmed in the making of this review.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The SOG Folding shovel is quite the dull letdown.
customer_reviews.text: I usually find SOG to be pretty good quality products considering their usually catered as budget survival items. In the case of this SOG Entrenching Tool, I am extremely disappointed in it overall. At $11, you would think that this would be a great buy to add to your camping kit, but unfortunately this little foldable shovel is extremely dull, and flimsy. You better be digging in the softest dirt ever, or you might be digging for quite a long time. I'm really confused at how this shovel got such great reviews, I gave mine away and wouldn't recommend anyone to buy this folding shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B. Bugay

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Low quality. Not worth the cool look haha. I’d rather it look like crap and work well. This thing bent the first time I used it!
customer_reviews.author: Joneaux

customer_reviews.title: didn't work  wish i cold send it back
customer_reviews.text: Won't Lock, wish i could return it , but I don't have the packaging. Made my 6 days in Yosemite Difficult..
customer_reviews.author: NoeVelasco

customer_reviews.title: Great little shovel
customer_reviews.text: Has held up nicely over the last year or so I've had this. It is showing some rust/ wear+tear near the shovel attachment point to the handle and on the blade itself but I have been using it to dig so that's expected at some point. Great for backpacking/ camping. Using to dig small latrine holes, dig out fire pits. I also use this around the house for yard work/gardening. I really like to functionality of it to turn it into a pick. I would recommend for the price/ purposes I listed.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your space in a ruck.
customer_reviews.text: With nine years of Infantry and Recon, this is an expert review. Lets start by stating that this entrenching tool is much smaller than a military issued version. With first use, the tool bent, and also would not stay tight. Being a smaller version seems to have given up major points of strength, that are very necessary when you are dependent on such a tool. SOG should be embarrassed to have any association with this garbage....Or maybe all thier products are of this quality, I will never know as I will not purchase any more of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ambriz

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment. Dysfunctional.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't work. Didn't open. Didn't latch. Didn't extend. We watched videos, read directions and had others try to do it thinking we were just idiots. No go and had to return. :/
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Very clever design, well made and compact
customer_reviews.text: I probably won't use this to dig huge holes, it is small for sure. It will be part of the tool kit in my Jeep Wrangler and used for emergencies only. Compared to the folding shovels I have purchased at military surplus stores, this is sturdier and also more compact. The case that comes with it is also much better made than the old canvas surplus ones I have purchased. The only downside is the built in saw on the shovel portion, it is only a couple inches long and not very sharp. If you are satisfied that this is a digging tool not a sawing tool it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Glad I didn't heed the negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this shovel after reading the negative reviews claiming it was flimsy or cheaply made. I took this on a 12mi backpacking trip and used it to break nearly frozen ground and bury food waste etc in bear country. It's sturdy and capable. If anything a little heavier than I really needed but I can't figure out what more you could ask of a shovel this size that would cause it to fail or bend like some people claimed. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent tool, I've had no real issues with it. Perfect size to throw in the motorcycle (or bicycle) pannier for basic campsite prepping chores (clearing debri, etc), but not much else (you won't be doing much resembling "digging" with this), but in reality, you can just use your boot to do most of that. It's a bit cheesy in construction (not the sturdiest folding shovel I've ever seen), but it's price is low, so imo it's worth the money even if it's a just in case I get stuck tool.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: It’s smaller than most e-tools
customer_reviews.text: Being a big fan of SOG and most of their products I had high expectations for this e-tool. I was highly disappointed with it though. Pro. It seems to be well made Light weight Pick feature Cons. It’s extremely small No telescoping handle The sheath or carry bag seems to be cheaply made. I wish I could love this, but it’s just to small, my toddlers could use it, but it really does nothing for someone my size, other than aggravates. I would suggest finding another quality made e-tool that has a larger shovel surface and a telescoping handle.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Varnell

customer_reviews.title: Handy little shovel
customer_reviews.text: I'll say that this is a handy "little" shovel. Picked this up for a week long hiking trip and while it was slightly heavier than I would have liked, I would have hoped it was also a little more sturdy. Mostly used it to build and clear the fire pits and had to consistantly tighten the lock but. I would not rely on this for protection against zombies or wolves. Just doesn't have the reach or solid appeal for any blunt force. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Low quality.
customer_reviews.text: I lost my garden shovel. I needed something small and grabbed this. After a few days of working with this the rivets holding the shovel blade on have become so loose the blade shakes. It feels as if it will fall apart. It is a disappointing product and not at all the quality I expected. It will dig a hole or two, but do not plan on using this for anything other than the very rare emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Useful & Lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Folds down nice and compact. Lightweight at about 2lbs. Comes with a nice little satchel to put it in. Initially I had trouble breaking it back down again because the tightening nut became too tight and I had to spend some time working on it trying to get it loose again. As for sturdiness, I can only tell you that this shovel will dig dirt but don't try and go any farther than the clay. You will not succeed except to bend it. Otherwise it's very handy for camping.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS E FAGAN

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for the money, no issues with it.
customer_reviews.text: Decent E tool type shovel for the money. Does the intended job of digging cat holes. I intentionally beat mine on rocks, sand, dirt, trees, stumps, cacti and has still not broke. I really don't understand all the negative reviews, this is actually a really decent e tool for the money. Yeah, the carrying case sucks a little, I wished it was MOLLE or at the least ALICE compatible. Being rerired military, I have confidence in this piece of gear and carry it in my bug out bag.
customer_reviews.author: hoffmiermp

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: This is a knockoff E-tool. It is smaller and weaker than a real E-tool. There is small print showing that the item is made in China. The box arrived ripped and there was no carrying pouch as advertised. I found an authentic E-Tool with case for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver Jr.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good for the $
customer_reviews.text: Great little shovel for the money! Locking collar I believe is aluminum, not plastic as some have said. Update: After using this little shovel digging around sand and rock along a river beach area I've managed to break it =( The piece that actually broke is where the rivets hold the shovel spade(head) to the folding hinge piece. The just: the rivets loosened allowing the hinge bracket piece to flex, ultimately stressing the steel beyond its elasticity resulting in it breakage. I guess to sum things up it's a decent little shovel for the price, and is compact and would likely serve its intended purpose. Great to fold up and throw behind the seat of the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Kal

customer_reviews.title: Heavy flimsy shovel
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this heavy flimsy item. Bought it for backpacking to Berry hours and our dog's waste. First off way too heavy for a backpack secondly the first hole I dug I bent the shovel and the ground was not even that hard. I think I could get the same results from a handheld gardening Spade. And save on weight!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Fischbach

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, was debating on purchasing it, but needed it in a pinch, as this was the only seller that guaranteed me receiving it before our backpacking trip. We were heading up North and camping in the snow. The shovel end is a little small, but it did what we expected it to do. We needed to dig out a couple of spots. If you are going to use it for anything else you might want to get an avalanche shovel, as the blade part is bigger. But this worked for us, just took a little longer to dig out the larger area. The weight is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Young

customer_reviews.title: SOG did a good job.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and the product description carefully before purchasing. I got exactly what I expected and wanted. Yes it is tiny, yes you will not be able to dig a hole to China, yes you will be able to tend a fire while camping and yes it is small so it can be packed perfectly on a motorcycle. In CA you are required to have a shovel, water and camp fire permit to have a fire in a Gov. campground. This is a solid little shovel for what it is intended for. SOG did a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Jack

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime Guarantee, good build quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this, not for digging foxholes, but for an emergency tool when I'm out and about on unpaved forest access roads or for light duty digging on the beach vacations. The all-metal construction, lifetime guarantee, and compact design when folded were all part of my purchasing decision. The excellent handle design makes for a sure, strong grip. I would personally avoid screw together shovels as they tend to loosen, or shovels with plastic fitting since those will break down just sitting in a hot car interior in the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: sharptalk

customer_reviews.title: Works, there are better shovels on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap small shovel I picked up for a back country camping trip. It works. Its hard to get the clamping nut tight enough to take the wiggle out of the shovel but worked well enough to dig out a little hole for a fire pit and other pits. The nylon carry case is trash. Was out 4 nights 5 days and had already worn through the case. Would not buy again, probably wont even use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is flimsy and I sent it back.
customer_reviews.text: I sent this back. It is junk and flimsy. I actually found a used German military one that is built very well. Buy a real military one if you can find one. Stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a Ok Product
customer_reviews.text: I have not Used to dig anything as of yet... but it seems very well designed, it was delivered to me on Jun 28, 2018, I had kept it in my room in a temperatured controlled house and some of the Non Power Coated Metal parts have already started to rust, I mean It seems Like a Ok Product, but like Spray it with WD40 as soon as it Arrives, might Make a it Four Star product to You, but I give it a Soild Three For the Ok Price, The Good Design, and And the Mmm Questionable Quality of Some of Metal Used in its Making
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Cerrito

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this gets mixed reviews but I thought I'd try it. Quite frankly, it's perfect for what it is. No it's not an actual entrenching shovel (read the description and this should be clear. It's blade is a little thin and it's not going to dig hard dirt or pry rocks. It's a small light weight shovel that you can throw in a back pack and not be lugging a bunch of extra weight around. It digs holes and moves dirt. I'd call it the perfect back packing shovel. Glad I bought it, I won't hike without it.
customer_reviews.author: pgdion

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price. Don't expect a cure for cancer when you paid $12 though
customer_reviews.text: For $12, it's fairly lightweight, seems sturdy enough for most dirt. Not quite an entrenching tool, but you're paying $12 for something that can dig a quick fire pit, or level the ground for sleeping. The pick is pretty good for hacking away at dry, clumpy dirt, and it's easy to screw the handle around to lock the shovel or pick in place. This is by no means a full shovel, but great for backpacking and a tiny solution.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi Vuong

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected but a great tool
customer_reviews.text: I will admit that I didn't realize that this shovel was smaller than other folding camp shovels that I had. I bought two of these to carry in ATVs in the event of emergencies. However, I ended up using them first for a landscaping project where I needed to dig a small trench. This worked perfectly. It was much more durable than the gardening trowels we had and the handle made it easier to use. I didn't feel like I was ever about to break or bend it. They will take up less room in the ATV bag too.
customer_reviews.author: Travis R

customer_reviews.title: Love my little shovel!
customer_reviews.text: Love my little shovel so much, I bought 2 of them. A great tool and well made, as all SOG products are. I use it when backpacking to dig fire pits, bury waste, etc. and when in our camper to dig a spot for the stabilizers when on uneven ground. Always seems that one stabilizer wont go all the way down. Pull out my shovel, and dig a place out. Works perfectly. I'm sure I'll find lots more uses for it.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made shovel
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for camping This amazing little shovel is so strong It folds up to about 8 inches tall when packed in the included bag Which also has a secured strap so it can be placed onto a belt without falling off It does turn-lock into place and will not close while using it is very well made Full carbon steel Easy use triangle handle 2sided whichever tool you lock into place Pics: 1-bag 2- bag and shovel folded up 3- unfolded shovel side 4- turn lock 5- trench tool 6- teeth on shovel Hope this helps;)
customer_reviews.author: DQ

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Beach!
customer_reviews.text: This SOG shovel is perfect for the beach. Lightweight, compact and easily fits in my bag that carries my beach shade which requires filling four sandbags. This shovel works great in sand that is either soft/dry or wet/compact. This shovel serves its purpose well for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Steevo

customer_reviews.title: Decent small E-Tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really tiny shovel. Much smaller than my folding Gerber E-Tool. It does fit nicely in a pack, though digging is somewhat awkward due to the size. Great for the camper, hiker, or prospector who needs to do some light shoveling to bury waste or quickly conceal some gold nuggets, but don't expect to throw up earthworks or entrench yourself with this puppy.
customer_reviews.author: BRYAN WOLFORD

customer_reviews.title: SOG Is a great brand, but might skip this one
customer_reviews.text: Have a few SOG items, I have really enjoyed them and did not read the reviews on this item, Just bought it when I saw the brand name. My mistake. Its kind of feels cheap, but I think it is designed for the emergency use instead of everyday use. I will still buy SOG items again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamjuve

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting something bigger
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I bought this shovel I was expecting something bigger. When folded up this fits in the palm of my hand. I bought this to put in my car emergency kit to use for things like getting my car going if it was snow packed. This would work better for small gardening tasks or digging a small latrine if you needed to. The shovel has a small saw on one edge of the blade. But as small as the blade is I do not imagine using this for anything other then small twigs.
customer_reviews.author: Pheonix Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: They're smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: If these tools were 5% smaller than they are, they would be toys. They are JUST BARELY large and sturdy enough to be useful, otherwise I would return them. As it is, they will be useful as a backup tool to be tucked away in each of our cars, so I'm not complaining. Just take a hard look at the measurements before you buy to make sure your expectations are in line.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Small and somewhat loose
customer_reviews.text: Decent shovel for adding to a survival kit, but make sure you understand how small 18” is. It does fold up very nicely and comes with a bag/sleeve (which is essential due to the pointer saw teeth on one side of the blade). The locking mechanisms aren’t the tightest and that was my biggest issue with this shovel. I purchased two for a set of car emergency kits and had planned to purchase a third at a later time for my own kit, but after seeing the actual product I’ll be doing more looking around.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Small shovel with good features
customer_reviews.text: Quality material with a good mechanical feel to the assembly. Used in my garden boxes to turn over soil. Ideal for that purpose as boxes are narrow and this is a very small shovel, a couple sizes up from a garden trowel. Finish seems good as I’ve not noticed rust or wear, though I’m good with my tools.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Not exciting, but reliable and a bargain
customer_reviews.text: This versatile entrenching tool is a bargain for the many things it can do. I keep one in the trunk of my car and have used it on many occasions. I got this one for one of my sons-in-law. He loves it too. I don't know how comfortable it would be clipped to your belt on a hike, but it certainly can easily be clipped onto most backpacks for a very handy camping tool. It's hard to beat the price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Doc K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Compact Shovel
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time this week and I liked it. It's compact and sharp. The shovel was wide enough where it only took us a couple of minutes to clear out a 12" deep by 12" in diameter hole. It's was easy for us to set up and take down and it also included a carrying pouch.
customer_reviews.author: T.W.

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect e-tool. This is the 2and one I've owned and love them. I have it on my hiking and camping bag, it's very light weight and and easy to fold.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan fisher

customer_reviews.title: Got me out of a sand dune in the desert
customer_reviews.text: Once, while I was traveling across South America during my around-the-world motorcycle tour, I got stuck in a sand dune somewhere in a Chilean desert, and this shovel got me out of it. I also made it a cool leather handle and sheath, and use it in a combo with the axe to up my dual-wielding skills.
customer_reviews.author: Fern

customer_reviews.title: Beware- tiny shovel
customer_reviews.text: Be aware- this is a small shovel- it is literally about half the size of a "standard" folding shovel/trenching tool. Shame on me for not checking the dimensions, but l figured they were all pretty much the same. This thing is literally half the size of the regular one I was replacing. Haven't really used it yet, but seems solid and well built, just like any other SOG product. I'm keeping it, so we'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. CrunchyTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and weighty and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, serious camping and tactical shovel. It has shovel mode, pick mode, and dual mode. It folds down to just the size of the shovel and packs away very neatly. It's a staple in my backpack when I'm snow hiking, and will be with me on all camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: One of the most light weight, durable, and effective folding shovels I have used. When you compare its size and weight to any other, you will find some bigger blade shovels but at the cost of higher weight. As long as you make sure to lock it down when unfolded this shovel is tough and strong. Dig dirt, cut turf, trenching, you name it. Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brent L

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and easy to lock in place...
customer_reviews.text: Small but perfect to keep in jeep for emergencies. Shocked at those who couldn't figure out how to lock the handle and head in place. It's a plastic twisting mechanism right on the straight part above the handle that locks everything down once you decide which head (pick or shovel) you want to use. It couldn't be easier. Well, I'm a jeep girl, maybe I'm just used to coming to everyone else's rescue, hahaha.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised, but I only used it once. It's better than the last shovel I had. The last one, I knew right away that I had ordered and bought a cheap product. This one feels sturdier. Looks sturdier. And doesn't wobble at the joints. The steel feels like real steel and not some weird "soon to bend" alloy. Nothing questionable about it. I would've given it five stars, but one outing isn't enough for me to leave a lasting impression on anyone who reads this. Four stars currently = top rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing build quality
customer_reviews.text: This shovel checks all of the boxes. It is lightweight, easy to carry in its own pouch, well made and engineered better than any of the other options I have found. Seriously, the way this is made is so simple it is ingenious. It just works. Great value and great product, this surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: HarvyDanger Films

customer_reviews.title: Compact and well built
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to keep in our Subaru Outback for road trip adventures. It is a perfect size and has a unique engineering aspect to it. Seems like it is very well built and exactly what we need for it's intended use. We haven't had the chance to put it to the test yet as it is frigid outside but we will update when we get to use it in action. So far it's exactly what I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: jpstephens100

customer_reviews.title: Under $9 sure seems worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This was a great price for a little entrenching tool I'll carry in my car for digging my way out of emergency situations, mostly. Folds very compactly, a nice little serrated area for a bit of emergency sawing. Minus one star for the fact that there's a bit of play between shovel and handle when it's all unfolded that I can't make go away. Still, eight dollars and change, so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity.
customer_reviews.text: It's simple it works it folds up the carrier is poorly made and has a solid band so it is closed molle carrier needs to be attached with accessorie also the cutter part will need to be filed and sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: Dakotah

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool for camping and backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: This little tool breaks down to the size of a large wallet. Obviously, the spade end is fairly small, but for typical camping or backpacking needs, it is perfect. I could fit 2-3 of these in one of the cup sleeves of my backpack. Granted, this little shovel is not ultralight by any means, the price makes it a worthwhile purchase if a slightly heavier alternative is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: badfish

customer_reviews.title: Handy for backyard gardening.
customer_reviews.text: Sections of my backyard are hard-packed and sun baked. I needed a tool to break things up in order to plant some new cacti. This folding multi-tool has been a real help; the pick broke up the surface, the spade removed the soil and the saw-edge dispatched the small roots I encountered. I did not experience the metal weakness some users have reported. I am happy with my new super-trowel.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrel S.

customer_reviews.title: Road injured critter assist device
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted this for her SUV. When she finds an injured or killed animal on the highway on the way home...she wants to get them off the road so their babies or sad friends do not get killed trying to stay by their side. This is compact and fits in the net part of the back of her vehicle. Apparently this makes a great Christmas gift for a wife with a big heart. Go figure......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved me twice now
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my car and have used it twice now to dig myself out of the snow. You have to watch the collar from coming loose, but other than that it is fantastic and did more to get under my tires than a full size shovel could.
customer_reviews.author: chemguy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Portable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my car. I live in an area that sees considerable snow in the winter, and I wanted a collapsible tool I could use either to dig my car out of snow or to spread sand over the snow. It is great for both tasks!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. S. Brook Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great little shovel
customer_reviews.text: Great little shovel I keep it in my emergency roadside kit. It's convenient because it folds up and when extended it is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Munchkin shovel--Yoho, yoho, yoho!
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived, I had to laugh out loud when I saw how tiny it was. I guess I was expecting a shovel similar to my old WWII folding infantry shovel. My bad for not researching the size carefully. I don't think anyone will be "entrenching" with is mini-me shovel. The blade is about the size of an adult hand. It's reasonably well made, but I don't think it will hold up when the digging gets tough. It should be fine for around the campsite and for the kids at the beach, although I think sand will wreck havoc on the adjustment collar. I'll add more comments later if it outperforms my first impressions. Yoho!
customer_reviews.author: MrMike

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I got my grandson a metal detector for Christmas. He went to the beach and lost the e-tool so I ordered this one and it's so much better than the one we had. Almost as good as the one I had in the Marine Corps!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Bangerter

customer_reviews.title: Small, decent carry case, and sturdy enough for emergency work.
customer_reviews.text: Small, decent carry case, and sturdy enough for light work. Used it the first weekend I had it to get a guy unstuck on the beach at the outer banks. When I pulled it out from behind my trucks back seat, he kinda chuckled. He wasn't chuckling after we had him out in less than 5 minutes. Takes no bed space, and gets the job done in a pinch. Decent emergency tool.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S. Cureton

customer_reviews.title: Too small to use, unless you are gardening...
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. I was expecting the same shovel the Army uses, the E-tool. This thing is no bigger than a garden spade, so unless you are planting flowers this is useless. Check the Dimensions!
customer_reviews.author: B.L.

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful little shovel. Key word: Little. It stows in the bag it comes with, and fits under the seat with ease. As I said, it's small, so if you have a big whole to dig, you'll be going at it for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: PapPappy

customer_reviews.title: Too small, Finger pinching, Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: There are some design issues. For one, it is small even for a folding shovel. Secondly, the materials are very very cheap. Thirdly, even after I had the locking ring down really tight, my daughter still got her hand pinched and it cut her finger open. That little spike on it was the culprit. It is just an unnecessary attachment. It would have been more durable without it.
customer_reviews.author: Mattbw3

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. It is an amazing camp shovel. Be warned the edges meant to cut are sharp as my wife found out by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Faas

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money light weight and easy to stash in bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 6 year old to go I to his hiking backpack. Have my E-Tool from the army. He always loves using it so why not buy him his own. Great choice he loves it also he carries it in his osprey daypack along with his other gear. Very light weight. Life time garuntee, yes that's right life time garuntee, son did you hear that ya that's right go to town with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Burton

customer_reviews.title: What are you using this for?
customer_reviews.text: For me this is a 5 Star product because I use it to shovel sand at the beach. If you are going to take it in a pack and use it for heavy duty stuff like earth and rock and cutting wood I am not sure this will be a 5 Star procure for you. I’m not saying it will Not do heavy duty stuff but I think it’s like taking a knife to a gun fight.
customer_reviews.author: Nobu

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: Thos shovel is pretty heavy duty for what it is. I bought this for my snowmobile and man when I got it. This thing has saved me a few times from a long walk. Very nice product and shows no sign of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: SOG Foldable Shovel...
customer_reviews.text: Is great! I love this tool. I always keep it in my trunk in my go bag. It’s great for digging your car out of snow among other uses. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: serviceable tool, nice to have
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as part of a gift with book:  and it was a big hit. Technically the entire gift was supposed to be a bit of a joke, but it is a perfectly serviceable tool that would be a nice addition to an emergency kit or to just throw into your car.
customer_reviews.author: Pam S.

customer_reviews.title: Well done SOG
customer_reviews.text: Was initially worried about the longevity of the plastic components but they've held up to two years in the Phoenix sun and getting banged around in the back of my truck. I'm impressed. Would buy another one if I had a need for it. Super useful and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality (small) entrenching tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I didn’t read description closely. Look at dimensions (18.25” long open) prior to buying. Ensure you know what to expect when opening the package (unlike I did)... I would still recommend, just really smaller than what I was wanting. I kept and used it. Works great. Quality is impeccable.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Emergency shovel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as an emergency shovel for use in my Jeep. It is a very sturdy and compact folding shovel. My only complaint is that it is too short for what I wanted to use it for. Still a nice emergency shovel and will continue to be standard equipment in my Jeep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for camping use and so far its worked great. Heavy to be used for extreme backpacking but ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for camping use and so far its worked great. Heavy to be used for extreme backpacking but for car camping or short hikes its a great tool to have. Doubles as a great chopper with the serated back of the shovel. Took a few minutes to figure out how to close it, but once you get past that, it's a breeze. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R.

customer_reviews.title: This particular product is poorly constructed, the blade does ...
customer_reviews.text: This particular product is poorly constructed, the blade does not lock into place well, and is completely unable to be used in the 90 degree postion, of which is part of where a stanard GI issue AMES etool shines as a rapid digging tool. This might work as a small emergency shovel, or for backpacking. But if youre going to be doing anything more than very light , infrequent digging, this tool is likely to let you down.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Walter II

customer_reviews.title: Great compact shovel
customer_reviews.text: Haven't put it to the test but feels very sturdy and easy to use and very light maybe 2 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Etienne baber

customer_reviews.title: I forgot where mine is but I had no issues
customer_reviews.text: Before I moved, I had this and I had no complaints. Although I never used it. Its good tool in case you're going camping and need to scoop up some poop.
customer_reviews.author: Ardika S

customer_reviews.title: Folds up nice and compact for carrying in a pack or pouch
customer_reviews.text: Have used it to dig small holes on the edges where woods meet wetlands. Has worked well, held up, for several trips this spring and will likely be around at least a few more seasons. Folds up nice and compact for carrying in a pack or pouch. Quiet when folded up, no rattles. Remember to give a good cleaning afterward especially digging in mud.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback of this etool is that the locking mechanism doesn't stay tight. I saw a lot of reviews claiming it was flimsy, not true. It's solid, small and lightweight. I opt for this over my 9" hunting knife for range. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ehrat

customer_reviews.title: VERY SMALL SHOVEL
customer_reviews.text: The shovel does not take up much room and can be carried very easy. I keep this one in my jeep at all times under seat with no problems. Yes there bigger ones but this one has it's place
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't hate it, but it's not worth $17 compared to discount chain versions
customer_reviews.text: I guess my expectation was higher for a "name" brand tool. This is absolutely no different/better than the stuff at Harbor Freight or other discount stores. There's nothing wrong with it specifically, but I have 3 different versions of entrenching tools and if you close your eyes, you can't tell them apart.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Hiker

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool little shovel
customer_reviews.text: small shovel i got to keep in my truck just in case. i haven't used it yet so i cant comment on the quality but the set up from unfolding to folding back up is pretty easy. don't expect to dig a trench with this thing, more like to have just in case i get stuck in snow. better prepared then unprepared, good buy
customer_reviews.author: darizo99

customer_reviews.title: the lock is not very user-friendly -- you have to look tight to prevent it from opening but it is not very easy to unlock
customer_reviews.text: much smaller than I expected (I seldom look at the measurements). the lock is not very user-friendly -- you have to look tight to prevent it from opening but it is not very easy to unlock. I don't have anything similar to compare with but I don't like this type of lock. don't expect to work like bigger sized shovel. my son used it on the beach and it worked great. for $9 with free shipping, you really can't beat it! but if you are thinking of serious camping/gardening work, get a bigger competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Eaglesnation

customer_reviews.title: The concept of this tool is great, but does not feel like SOG Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I like SOG, and have used their Knives so I know that their product is good quality. However this tool does not have the SOG feel to it. The locking mechanism was little faulty and it made everything loose could not use it as it kept shutting on us. It is pretty cheep in price, folds ups great and is light in weight, but it is cheaply made, and probably only good for light weight use.
customer_reviews.author: KAW

customer_reviews.title: Very compact SOG has lifetime warranty
customer_reviews.text: I like the size when folded. I can leave it in the tool bag or put it behind the seat in my service truck. It's my helper lesson teacher. When my helpers don't want to do anything i make them dig a trench and yhe following day they have to cover it up like no trench was ever dug. Wrapped paracord around the handle and am excited for someone to force me to use it on them.
customer_reviews.author: Jose O.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool
customer_reviews.text: It is SOG so you know it's good, one thing though pay attention to the dimension it is smaller than you think, if you are prior service the blade is about half of your issue shovel. That being said it is very compact and very functional. Perfect for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Using this shovel at the beach to dig a small hole for beach umbrellas. Works perfectly. Folds up into a small pouch that fits easily into beach bag. Light weight for easy carrying.
customer_reviews.author: BerchT

customer_reviews.title: Great size and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Only downsize is its shortness. all the others of this type i have owned allowed the shovel to extend a little so its not as short. quality is there and will not complain.
customer_reviews.author: matthew demay

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: This was the second shovel I had to buy. You can't buy anything with metal shaft at the local hardware store. They only carry wood handle for smaller shovels. The first folding type shovel I bought wasn't too great as the thread-in design actually caused the threads to jump and eventaully widen the hole so it never stayed tight. This item gets better leverage; it cuts similar to a planter's trowel. The locking, tho, isn't completely tight and the blade can move a little but it doesnt affect function. The shovel blade could stand to be thicker.
customer_reviews.author: MangoAve

customer_reviews.title: RV must have
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the RV, because you never know when we need it
customer_reviews.author: TahoeEntleMom

customer_reviews.title: Compact. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It's a small, lightweight shovel that you can keep in the back of your car. Small enough for a backpack. Seems sturdy but I wouldn't use the pick part for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: This thing was really cool but smaller than I expected so I returned it ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing was really cool but smaller than I expected so I returned it and I have to leave a review for it to get out of my awaiting reviews sections. This would be a really good shovel for short trips or even just to keep in your car. I was looking for something that was a bit more sturdy than this one, and because it does fold up, you should expect less sturdiness as well. The SOG brand makes amazing products, but this shovel wasn't what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kay B.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and durable
customer_reviews.text: This shovel has gotten me unstuck on the samd in the desert more than a few times, as well as trenching out paths to drain water from camp. Durable, feels solid in my hands as I work, and folds down compactly to save space in my overlanding rig.
customer_reviews.author: Madmnky13

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, but small
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is really handy to be able to take out on the trail with me in my backpack when i go mountain-biking, but it is EXTREMELY small, so don't expect to do any heavy digging with it. It's good for touching up a landing or making a lip just a little more crisp, but you're not building an entire jump from scratch with this little guy. I'd suggest looking up some youtube reviews of it so you can see the size before purchasing to make sure it will fit your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Objects may be smaller than they appear.
customer_reviews.text: If you are hoping for a tool to dig your car out of sand or snow, keep looking. I should have done better research or read the description more carefully....but this shovel is quite small-- great for a backpack or for a camp shovel. The blade is perhaps 4" wide and the unit folds up very compactly. Good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jones

customer_reviews.title: It's okay - Expected a little better quality from SOG
customer_reviews.text: It's decent. Gets the job done...eventually. I've always had problems where I can't get the "screw-down-part" tight enough, so the shovel part collapses on itself during use. Fairly easy to adjust, but wish I didn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: James Walters

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it will hold up, but seems to be a nice light weight tool that I’m happy to have in my camping gear. I’ll follow up after using this compact tool.
customer_reviews.author: Shon lantych

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Oh my God do not waste your money the shovel my child plays with in his sandbox is bigger than this thing what a joke of an item Amazon will sell anything anymore this is a sad attempt add a survival shovel
customer_reviews.author: William G Williams

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Will you dig a trench or fox hole with it? Of course not. Will it cone in handy in an EDC bugout bag for emergency use? I think it will. That's why it's residing in mine ready for use when it's not practical to carry a full size trench tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Multi Purpose..
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I'm very glad to have them in the car in case of emergency. I also used it for gardening the other day...
customer_reviews.author: Blake Stark

customer_reviews.title: not a very sturdy material - used it one time but the contraption ...
customer_reviews.text: not a very sturdy material - used it one time but the contraption connecting the head and the handle bent; trashed it
customer_reviews.author: Mang Iso Kayo

product_meta.title: SOG Folding Shovel Survival Shovel – Entrenching Tool 18.25 Inch Foldable Shovel Camping Shovel w/ Wood Saw Edge and Tactical Shovel Carry Case (F08-N),black
product_meta.description:
The SOG Entrenching Tool advances the tradition of the classic survival shovel by making it more durable, more portable and more powerful. Hang it from your belt using the included ballistic nylon sheath or keep it in your pack for digging, hoeing, sawing and other essential survival tasks.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
A folding shovel can be an indispensable tool in today's constantly changing environment. When you need to move sand, dirt or snow you wish you had that shovel close at hand. The all-steel construction entrenching tool features a tempered-steel blade with teeth cut into it for cutting and slashing. The triangular handle is strong and fits the hand well.
feature_bullets: BARELY BIGGER THAN YOUR HAND: That’s the size of the Entrenching Tool when folded; this camp shovel, snow shovel, sand shovel or gardening shovel works as a small shovel for big jobs
18.25 INCH FULL LENGTH, 24.5 OUNCES: Foldable military shovel and hunting shovel w/ a wood saw edge and a rotating spade shovel blade to use as a pick or hoe; versatile E tool w/ strong shovel handle
3-WAY FOLDING DESIGN: Hand shovel collapses into a portable outdoor shovel, emergency shovel and hiking shovel; a compact E tool for your camping gear that’s not as bulky as other shovels for digging
HIGH-CARBON STEEL CONSTRUCTION AND CARRY CASE: Super durable for a mini shovel; pack it into its small shovel case and carry it on your back pack or belt
SOG TACTICAL SHOVEL FOR LIFE: Take care of your folding shovel and we’ll take care of you; SOG shovels for digging are built to last, and we consider all repair and replacement requests

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,046 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
